Model

Class Ball

  • java.lang.Object
    • Model.GameObject
      • Model.MovableObject
        • Model.Ball
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Ball
extends MovableObject
    Class for balls - object that bounces off the racket and destroy bricks. It has additional field - radius to make calculations more clear.
    Author:
    Antek
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • bounce

        public void bounce(Racket racket)
        Function for balls only. Changes X and Y directions and speeds of ball depending on the place when racket got hit. The closer to the middle of racket ball has hit, the bigger speed o y_axis is. Falling on the right half of the racket will result with ball bouncing to the right, falling on the left side will result with ball bouncing to the left.
        Parameters:
        racket -

      • processCollision

        public void processCollision(GameObject go)
        Description copied from class: MovableObject
        Implementation of this abstract function specifies what movableObject do after collision with GameObject go.
        Specified by:
        processCollision in class MovableObject
        Parameters:
        go - - gameObject, which collide with movableObject

      • moreAtSide

        public boolean moreAtSide(GameObject go)
        Function called when ball collide at the same time with 2 edges of given Gameobject(most probably brick): on the side and top/bottom edge of the GameObject. It determinates whether bigger part of ball is at side or not.
        Parameters:
        go - - gameObject that was hit by the ball at more than one side
        Returns:
        true, if ball is more at the side of gameObject than above/below it.

      • toDelete

        public boolean toDelete()
        Description copied from class: MovableObject
        Function called to check if movableObject should be destroyed.
        Overrides:
        toDelete in class MovableObject
        Returns:
        true, if movableObject should be deleted.
